flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
One of the great aspects of the Arduino Leonardo, and the Atmega32u4 at the heart of it, is its ability to act as either a keyboard or mouse.

This way your sketches can send keyboard strokes or mouse movements to your computer, allowing your microcontroller to perform actions on your computer!

lines.text: One of the awesome properties of the Arduino Leonardo, or more specifically the Atmega 32u4 at the heart of it, is the ability to emulate a HID controller.
lines.text_raw: One of the awesome properties of the Arduino Leonardo, or more specifically the Atmega 32u4 at the heart of it, is the ability to emulate a HID controller.

lines.text: Human Interface Devices are things like computer mice and external keyboards that connect to your computer through its USB ports.
lines.text_raw: Human Interface Devices are things like computer mice and external keyboards that connect to your computer through its USB ports.

lines.text: This project acts like a custom external keyboard that will send keystrokes to you computer based on input it receives from a remote control.
lines.text_raw: This project acts like a custom external keyboard that will send keystrokes to you computer based on input it receives from a remote control.

guide.summary: This project creates a simple interface than can turn remote control buttons into keyboard strokes on your computer. You can use it to control programs and apps while away from your keyboard.
guide.title: Control your Computer with a Remote Control
